action.action-desc: Mrs. Bustos (for herself, Mrs. Kirkpatrick, Ms. Kelly of Illinois, Ms. Edwards, and Mr. Quigley) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow the work opportunity credit for hiring individuals who are veterans or members of the Ready Reserve or National Guard, to make permanent the work opportunity credit, and to expand and make permanent the employer wage credit for employees who are active duty members of the uniformed services.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Jobs for Heroes Act.

section.header: Work opportunity credit for hiring veterans and members of Ready Reserve or National Guard

subsection.header: Expansion of veterans eligible for credit

paragraph.text: Section 51(d)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:
The term qualified veteran means any individual who is certified by the designated local agency as—

clause.text: having served on active duty (other than active duty for training) in the Armed Forces of the United States for a period of more than 180 days, or
having been discharged or released from active duty in the Armed Forces of the United States for a service-connected disability, and

subparagraph.text: not having any day during the 60-day period ending on the hiring date which was a day of extended active duty in the Armed Forces of the United States.

paragraph.continuation-text: For purposes of subparagraph (B), the term extended active duty means a period of more than 90 days during which the individual was on active duty (other than active duty for training).

subparagraph.text: Section 51(b) of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:
A veteran is described in this subparagraph if such veteran is certified by the designated local agency as—

clause.text: entitled to compensation for a service-connected disability, and
having a hiring date which is not more than 1 year after having been discharged or released from active duty in the Armed Forces of the United States.

subparagraph.text: A veteran is described in this subparagraph if such veteran is certified by the designated local agency as having aggregate periods of unemployment during the 1-year period ending on the hiring date which equal or exceed 6 months.
A veteran is described in this subparagraph if such veteran is certified by the designated local agency as—

clause.text: entitled to compensation for a service-connected disability, and
having aggregate periods of unemployment during the 1-year period ending on the hiring date which equal or exceed 6 months.

paragraph.text: For purposes of paragraph (4), the terms compensation and service-connected have the meanings given such terms under section 101 of title 38, United States Code.

subparagraph.text: Section 51(b)(3) of such Code is amended—

clause.text: by striking subsection (d)(3)(A)(ii)(I) and inserting paragraph (4)(A),
by striking subsection (d)(3)(A)(iv) and inserting paragraph (4)(B), and
by striking subsection (d)(3)(A)(ii)(II) and inserting paragraph (4)(C).

subsection.header: Application of credit to members of Ready Reserve and National Guard

paragraph.text: Section 51(d)(1) of such Code is amended by striking or at the end of subparagraph (H), by striking the period at the end of subparagraph (I) and inserting , or, and by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: a qualified member of the Ready Reserve or National Guard.

paragraph.header: Qualified member of the Ready Reserve or National Guard
paragraph.text: Section 51(d) of such Code is amended by striking paragraph (14), by redesignating paragraphs (11), (12), and (13) as paragraphs (12), (13), and (14), respectively, and by inserting after paragraph (10) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Qualified member of the Ready Reserve or National Guard
paragraph.text: The term qualified member of the Ready Reserve or National Guard means any individual who is certified by the designated local agency as being a member of—

subparagraph.text: the Ready Reserve (as described in section 10142 of title 10, United States Code), or
the National Guard (as defined in section 101(c)(1) of such title 10).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to individuals who begin work for the employer after the date of the enactment of this Act.
Section 51(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking paragraphs (4) and (5).
The amendment made by this section shall apply to individuals who begin work for the employer after December 31, 2015.

section.header: Employer wage credit for employees who are active duty members of the uniformed services expanded and made permanent

subsection.header: Credit allowable to all employers without regard to size

paragraph.text: Section 45P(b)(3)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking any employer which and all that follows through under a written plan and inserting any employer which, under a written plan.

subparagraph.text: Subsections (a) and (b)(3)(A) of section 45P of such Code are each amended by striking eligible small business employer and inserting eligible employer.
Section 45P(b)(3) of such Code is amended by striking eligible small business employer in the heading thereof and inserting eligible employer.

subsection.text: Section 45P of such Code is amended by striking subsection (f).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to payments made after December 31, 2015.
